CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 2, 1967, pg. 14, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Harry D. Clark...Cutting Cake." Article reads: "Pittsburgh Teachers Wed - After a trip to Atlantic City, Mr. and Mrs. Harry D. Clark will live in Pittsburgh. They  were married recently at St. Paul AME Church.  A reception followed at the Pick - Roosevelt Hotel.  The bride, the former Barbara Lee Alstonn [sic], was escorted to the altar by ehr [sic] uncle, Armour Strother.  She choose a floor length coat and gown ensemble of Ivory silk lace peau.  The gown was fashioned with a scoop neckline, Kabuki sleeves, and an empire bodice.  Alencon lace accented the bodice and bottom of the sheath skirt.  The sleeveless coat with bow trim shoulders extended into a chappel train.  She carried glamellia and lilies of the valley.  Marlene Wasylik was her maid of honor.  Other bridal attendants were Miss Althea Clark and Phillis Clark, sisters of the groom; Cathy Moore, cousin of the bride; Mrs. Margot Strong, Kathryn Tashler, and two flower girls, Leslie McDaniel, and Lynette Taliaferro, who are also cousins of the bride.  Mr. Clark, son of Mr. and Mrs. H. B. Clark had Dr. Raymond Hayes as best man.  Other ushers were, John Alston, brother of the bride, Ronald Bickel, William Crawford, cousins of the bride, and Walter Lowry, cousin of the bride, also Harold Hayes, Bryant Salter and Steven Wagner and John McDonald.  The bride is a graduate of Duquesne University, and is a teacher in public school system.  Mr. Clark is also a graduate of Duquesne University, and is a teacher of music in the public school system.  Miss Alston is the granddaughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Marshall Lowrys of the Northside."
TitMainTitle: Groom Harry D. Clark wearing light colored dinner jacket and bow tie, and bride Barbara Lee Alston Clark wearing short sleeved gown and pearl choker, standing behind four tiered wedding cake with two layers separated by champagne glasses, possibly in Roosevelt Hotel
